ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a great deal about American government, as well as the way it compares to other governments globally.

I really enjoyed this class because I was able to learn a lot of new things while also enhancing pass insights and skills that I already garnered from past classes. The discussions in this class were also always positive and inviting.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The discussions in this class were productive and engaging.
The readings Professor Fairdosi assigned were very interesting and the weekly responses, as well as class discussion leader role was very helpful in engaging with  the material.
I think the class has no weaknesses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend this class, especially if you have an interest in politics/government.
Yes, Professor Fairdosi is great and it is an interesting seminar.
Yeah. Amir is great and super knowledgeable. Take it!
I would recommend this course to other students because it is geared toward student learning and invites student engagement.

Absolutely! Professor Fairdosi is a great seminar leader, and he set up a really great and well-crafted syllabus. The material was always interesting and easy to engage with, and coming to class was always a pleasure.
